intro: Thelysia persica, commonly known as the Persian rose, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant pink to red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are five-petaled and have a delicate, fragrant scent, making it a popular ornamental plant. Thelysia persica prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in temperate climates.
